Package fig.record

Interface Summary
CommandNode A command node basically takes the record node specified by the local command environment and returns another record node.
Matcher  
ReceiverInterface What the server will use to make callbacks to the client receiver.
Recordable If an object is recordable, we can add it the static record.
RecordNode The RecordNode is the basic building block of the entire framework.
RecordServerInterface  
SubsetHint Selects a subset of the indices from a set 0, ..., n-1.
 

Class Summary
AbstractRecordNode Most of the record node functionality is here.
AllMatcher Matches all strings.
ArgsParser Parses the arguments of a function.
ArrayRecordable<T>  
BufferedReceiver Getting output back to the client is expensive if we have to make so many RMI calls, so use a buffer for the standard output.
CombineCommandNode A combine command node has many children.
CommandEnv The environment in which a command node is executed.
CommandProcessor Responsible for sending some commands to the server.
CommandUtils Utilities for parsing commands.
DirRecordNode A directory entries.
ExactMatcher  
FileRecordNode A file consists of a path and a character offset into that file.
FilterCommandNode A filter command node operates on a record node by returning a record node that only has a subset of its children.
FullRecordNode A record node with explicit list of children.
FuncCommandNode A function command node includes a rich set of basic functions that operate on record nodes.
GlobalEnv An environment.
GnuPlotter Interface with gnuplot.
GnuPlotter.Histogram  
GnuPlotter.Plot  
GnuPlotter.Scatter  
GnuPlotter.TimeSeries  
LeafRecordNode A record node without children.
LoadFileState  
LocalCommandEnv Local environment that's used during the execution of a command node only.
Mandate  
Mandate.FileBundle  
NumMatcher  
OffsetReader A wrapper around BufferedReader.
OrMatcher  
PathRecordNode In general, load children lazily upon request.
PeriodicSubsetHint Selects a subset of the indices based on a [start, end) interval and a step or a count.
Receiver What the client should do.
Record Record is a static class for instrumenting the state of an execution.
RecordNodeMatcher  
RecordNodeUtils  
RecordServer  
RecordServer.Options  
RecordShell  
RecordShell.Options  
RegexMatcher  
ResultReceiver When the RecordShell client is behind a firewall, we cannot use RMI callbacks.
StructRecordNode A structured record node.
SubsetHintUtils  
TwigRecordNode A record node with exactly at most one child.
VarBindingList Variable bindings list.
